artist: Artist: Emmi Whitehorse; Printer: Hand Graphics, Santa Fe, New Mexico; Publisher: Zanatta Editions, Shawnee, Kansas
classification: Drawings; Prints; Collages / Assemblages; Works on Paper
creditline: Gift of funds from Barbara S. Longfellow
description: abstract image; blue/black ground with white and blue flower petal outlines; clusters of white and blue circles (like hydrangea blossoms); blue leaves; other circular shapes in blues, purple, red and greens
markings: Artist\'s mark in red pencil, LRC: III
medium: Color monotype and collage with hand-drawn additions in graphite, colored pencil, chalk, oil stick, and varnish on paper
provenance: The artist, Santa Fe, N.M.; [Joe Zanatta Contemporary Art, Shawnee, Kansas]; sold to MIA, 2015.
signed: Signed, dated, and titled in pencil, verso: June 2011  \"Pollination\"  Emmi Whitehorse
text: Emmi Whitehorse blends the physical with the metaphysical, the real with the imagined in this mixed-media work on paper. Informed by nature’s beauty and Diné culture, the work takes the form of an ethereal landscape. Its ambiguous, atmospheric space is populated by an assortment of abstract, symbolic, and biomorphic forms that seem to float across a ground of deep, luxuriant color. Seeds, leaves, plants, and dried flowers intermingle with numbers, Navajo signs, and fragments of curved lines. Though neither descriptive nor narrative, the work demonstrates Whitehorse’s fine-tuned ability to fuse disparate elements within a lyrical realm of experience, memory, and contemplation.
title: Pollination
